roles.note: Sometimes also with an empty Arg1 (trace only)

example.name: active, light S as object
example.text: The documents also said that Cray Computer anticipates *trace* needing perhaps another $120 million in financing beginning next September.
example.arg: *trace* needing perhaps another $120 million in financing beginning next September.

example.name: active, SBAR as object
example.text: But [speculators]-2, *trace*-2 anticipating that Connecticut will approve a law permitting such interstate banking soon, immediately bid up shares of Connecticut banks on the news.
example.arg: that Connecticut will approve a law permitting such interstate banking soon

example.name: passivized with extraction
example.text: John is anticipated *trace* to win the Nobel Prize.

example.name: with comparative
example.text: ``This is all emotion right now, and when emotion starts to run, it can run further than anyone anticipates,'' he said.

roleset.name: come before

example.name: active
example.text: The downgrade anticipates completion of the IMA Holdings acquisition today, Moody's said.
example.arg: completion of the IMA Holdings acquisition today

roleset.note: These two senses are very close in meaning, but fortunately the framing is the same.

predicate.note: Frames file for 'anticipate' based on survey of sentences in financial subcorpus.
